Title: Associate Dentist - Nipigon, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Associate Dentist PT or FT
Sovereign Dental is looking to fill the position of a Full-Time or Part-Time Associate Dentist to join our practice. Sovereign Dental is located in the beautiful heart of Nipigon. As an Associate, you will be required to exam the patient's teeth and gums to diagnose and treat various oral health issues. Provide dental treatment to patients, extractions, dental fillings, cavity, Tooth decay treatments, teeth whitening, applications of dental crowns and caps.
We have three practice locations in Canada. Our goal is to provide professional, world-class dental care; to make every patient feel perfectly at home and relaxed, and work to improve and help our community.
An opportunity for the selected candidate to experience the beautiful Nipigon in Northwestern Ontario. Our Nipigon location is busy. The area is surrounded by dramatic shorelines, freshwater lakes, and rugged landscapes.
Education and Qualification:
Doctor of dental surgery (DDS) or doctor of medicine in dentistry (DMD).
Successful completion of The National Dental Examining Board of Canada (NDEB).
Requirement:
Minimum of 2 years working experience in a dental practice (New graduates are welcome to apply).
The ability to use various dental instruments and equipment.
The ability to remain calm in stressful situations.
The ability to work in a team.
Good hand-eye coordination.
Excellent communication skills.
Helpful and polite.
What we are offering:
Well-established practice and the only dental office in the community.
Payment to the Associate dentist is 45% of collections.
Access to newly renovated, 4 operatory practices with digital radiographs (including PAN), paperless charting, and intraoral cameras.
Access to our 1000+ patient database.
Flexible schedule.
Highly skilled, dedicated team to support you in delivering treatment.
Great team at the front desk to make bookings and managing your schedule efficiently, and effectively.
Opportunity to work in a diverse environment.
Sovereign Dental is privately owned and not part of a Dental Corporation.
Reference ID: 20210930
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Every person entering the office is expected to wear a face mask/covering and will be asked to sanitize their hands immediately upon entry and exit. If you do not have a mask one will be provided for you upon arrival.

Nipigon, ON: reliably commute or be willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (preferred)

Title: Family Practice Doctor - North Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
IMG SUPPORT AVAILABLE at this fantastic location.
Clinic in Vancouver’s Beautiful North Shore
Located in North Vancouver, British Columbia Lynn Valley Medical clinic is looking for a full-time and/or part-time Family Physician to join their Family Practice/Walk-in clinic. The clinic uses Oscar EMR and offers billing support. The payment structure is fee-for-service, the split arrangement is 70/30, and the range of potential annual earnings is $300,000-$400,000.
Clinic Details: The clinic is open 7 days a week, has a pharmacy next door and laboratory, physiotherapy and dentist in the same building. There is a small procedures room for lumps and bumps. Virtual consultations are available, although the clinic is looking for an onsite family physician. There are 2 full-time and 2 part-time Family Physicians currently working at the facility, and an incoming Registered Nurse starting in January.
The clinic is located in a stunning area of Metro Vancouver, known for it is outdoorsy lifestyle, west coast vibe, and surrounding hiking and biking trails.
Certification and Licensure:
Hold or soon to attain Certification in the College of Family Physicians (CCFP).
Hold or eligible for full license to practice medicine in BC.
Good standing with BC College of Physicians.
No hospital privilege's required.
Provisional license eligible applicants welcome to apply.
Get in touch with the recruitment team at the North Shore Divisions of Family Practice today to learn more about this opportunity and to discuss your preferences for other similar opportunities throughout the North Shore, Sea to Sky, and Sunshine Coast region.

Title: Associate Dentist - Dr. Rachel Navaneelan & Associates - Cornwall, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About us:
At Dr. Rachel Navaneelan & Associates, we offer a wide selection of dental services for the whole family including preventive, restorative and cosmetic care to help you achieve your ideal oral health. In addition to Cornwall, we serve Akwesasne and Cornwall Island.
https://www.drnavaneelan.com/site/home
Services Schedule: Part-Time/Full-Time
The Opportunity
We are currently looking for an Associate Dentist to provide services, on an independent contractor basis, to our busy and well-established practice. The successful individual will have a passion for building strong patient relationships and contributing to the ongoing oral health of their community. As an independent contractor at our practice, you will work with a strong group of dental professionals, with access to a variety of learning opportunities and industry-leading continuing education.
Why Should You Join?
Professional development
: You will have the support, tools, and encouragement you need to grow and evolve as a professional on your individual career path, including access to industry-leading continuing education through the award-winning DC Institute (dcinstitute.ca).
Competitive service fees
: Our service fees packages are reviewed annually in a comparative study that ensures alignment with industry standards.
Established and stable practice:
Our successful practice is a leader in patient care, providing a range of services to a loyal and established patient base.
Health & Safety and Compliance
: The practice has a strong health and safety culture, with compliance measures embedded in every aspect of the workplace.
Network of experienced dental professionals
: You will have opportunities for formal and structured mentorship with esteemed team members and colleagues and access to industry-leading experts in various dental disciplines.
Team-oriented:
When you join our practice, you join a team of supportive and like-minded professionals working together to achieve common goals that are understood and shared by all.
Respect for our people
: The team is built on a culture of respect and positivity, where we celebrate individuality and value each other's unique strengths and contributions.
Work-life flexibility
: Everyone has a life outside the practice, and we are committed to helping each team member find a healthy, sustainable balance between home and career.
About You:
Graduate from an accredited DDS/DMD Program or successful completion of the National Dental Examining Board of Canada (NDEB) Equivalency Process
Registered, licensed and in good standing with the Provincial Dental Board
Valid CPR certification
Independent contractors must be domiciled in Canada. We thank all independent contractors, but only suitable independent contractors will be contacted. Independent contractors with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process and thereafter can contact our Talent Team at
450-210-1563
. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

Title: International Student Recruitment and Health Sciences Admission - White Rock, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Company description
Swenam is an Educational Canadian Corporation based in the province of British Columbia in Canada. We have been providing the best educational and consultation services since 2014 to students at universities, colleges and schools. Swenam helps prepare students all over the world to come and study in Canada.
Job description
International Student Recruitment (Golf Region) and Health Sciences Admission Coordinator
POSITION SUMMARY
The Coordinator of International Recruitment and Health Sciences Admission recruits prospective international and internationally educated students who wants to pursue health science degree in Canadian and American institutions. The coordinator informs, encourages, and advises prospective international students. The coordinator also works with government bodies, other institutions, other departments, and agencies to support the ongoing recruitment and advising of students.
With the increased number of international students coming from golf and middle eastern countries intending to study Health Science programs in Canada, and with the current great expansion the Swenam organization is experiencing in these regions, the management team has decided to establish a whole division in Swenam’s admission department. This newly established division will solely focus on students coming from this region and their needs to better serve the mission of our organization. Therefor, we will be looking for an enthusiastic individual with great health science background and management skills to lead that division and train staff in it. This individual must be familiar with the countries in the aforementioned region, in terms of culture awareness, culture sensitivities, religious beliefs, educational systems, schools, and traditions, to facilitate the communication and therefore the recruitment efforts. The International Student Recruitment and Health Sciences Admission Coordinator will be expected to spend some of their time in late 2022 in the new established Swenam Organization Golf Region Headquarter in Dubai, this location is expected to open in October 2022, given the current global situation keeps improving as expected.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Delivering - high quality and engaging Health Science programs experience that facilitate student outcomes and satisfaction
Provides access to Swenam's leading services, content & curricula that support these programs
Serve as the “project manager” for the student journey
Participate in the recruitment, admission, registration, and enrolment of international students.
Establish and maintain personal direct contact with prospective international students from initial contact through to the point of enrolment.
Determine the student's academic needs and make appropriate recommendations to maximize their chances of reaching their personal goals
Educate, strategize, and present effective strategies to students in college/university admission, academic planning, and career planning
Develop positive relationships with students on an ongoing basis and mentor students on a regular weekly basis
Ability to travel to Golf region and connect and develop relationships with schools, communities, and other business organizations to facilitate student recruitments
Maintain prospective international student records in the Swenam database.
Provide application, admission, and course selection assistance to incoming international students.
Build relationships with key influencers in the local international community
Be the student's and parent's consistent point of contact throughout the program once their Swenam Service Agreement has begun
To assist in the actions steps of student's plan as directed by their Swenam Team (strategists, tutors, and consultants)
Work with organizations world-wide to establish Swenam Organization as a viable destination for international students
Develop and implement all procedures related to agents who work on behalf of Swenam’s for recruitment purposes, including:
Selection of Sub-Agents to represent Swenam
Hire, train, and update agency staff
Participate in joint recruiting activities
Provide ongoing support to agency staff
Review of agencies to measure their effectiveness and fit for Swenam’s
Review and process forms for commission payments to agents
Keep country-specific admission policies current through ongoing research
Remain up to date on all areas that affect international students including but not limited to government regulations, cultural sensitivities and cultural awareness
Maintain and develop content on international student’s web page
Liaise with all departments that work closely with international students, educating individuals as required
Conduct information sessions for prospective and current students on issues relating to their immigration status as international students in Canada, with the help of our collaborating immigration lawyers and immigration department.
Represent The Swenam Organization on relevant external committees and with government agencies responsible for the international student portfolio
Travel may be required, either within Canada or internationally
Support the overall work of the Swenam Admissions Department
Successfully lead the Swenam Health Science Division for Students coming from Golf countries and Middle Eastern countries.
Help train new staff joining the division on regular basis.
Help internationally trained doctors, dentists, and nurses with their practice licence acquiring processes, before and after arriving to Canada.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Health Sciences, preferably in Medicine or Dentistry.
Being an international trained medical or dental doctor is an asset.
Being aware of the federal Canadian regulatory requirements for internationally trained doctors, dentist and nurses to practice their profession in Canada, is an asset.
Good experience, at least theoretically, with healthcare management skills.
Excellent communication skills
Cross cultural experience is required
Must be familiar with the golf region culture sensitivities, beliefs and educational systems.
Must have lived in the golf countries for at least 2-4 years
Previous experience in international recruitment is an asset, but not required since training will be provided.
Strong interpersonal relationship and crisis management skills
Good organizational skills
Must be familiar with the Healthcare System in the Golf region.
Must have healthcare management skills
Self-motivated
Ability to travel internationally
Professionalism, Time and Stress Management, Confidence, Positive attitude (patience, empathy), Willingness to learn and go the extra mile
The person must be bilingual (English and Arabic)
Equity and diversity are essential to the excellence and success in any field. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
Canadians and Permanent Residents of Canada will be given priority. Please indicate your legal status to work in Canada.
We thank all applicants, but please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.
HOW TO APPLY & APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined in the Position Requirements section above. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the knowledge, skills, abilities and competencies as outlined in the Job Description.
A cover letter
is required as part of your application. The content and/or format of your cover letter may be evaluated as part of the assessment process.
Ensure your resume includes your educational accomplishments, employment history including start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.
Your application should be a
consolidated PDF file
(only) includes updated CV and a Cover Letter. Your PDF file must be saved in the following format: first name-last name-0035BD2021. Please use the subject line: ''
0035BD2021''
Salary: Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and relevant experience.
Term: One year with the possibility of extension.
Start date: February 1, 2022
NOTE:
Applications will be accepted until November 26th at 11:00pm PST. Late applications will not be accepted.
Reference ID: 0035BD2021
Contract length: 12 months

Choice Dental Group is looking for 2 Dental Associates to join our rapidly growing new group. You can’t afford to miss out on this once in a lifetime opportunity.

Our goal is to help you develop both professionally and personally to reach your highest level of excellence.

Our 5-star Google reviews say it all.

403-393-7226

Title: Dental Receptionist - Cool Aid Dental Clinic #471 - Victoria, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
This is a unique opportunity to join an innovative not-for-profit, in an environment that is committed to promoting continuous learning, creativity and collaboration.
The Cool Aid Dental Clinic works in association with the Victoria Cool Aid Society, providing full dental services for adults that have multiple barriers to accessing dental care. The dental reception position is a rewarding opportunity to work in the non-profit sector with an emphasis on providing affordable dental treatment for those who are on a fixed income or have Ministry coverage. The receptionist will be a valued part of a cheerful team that is passionate about making a difference in the community.
The Dental Receptionist works in a supportive capacity with other members of the dental clinic team. Responsibilities include maintenance of client records, booking appointments, billing, maintaining and balancing cash records, receiving and providing information to clients and the public, understanding government and carrier benefit guidelines and providing clerical support.
The successful applicant will have the ability to organize work, manage time and carry out the duties of the position with independence. In addition, they will have experience in clinical or other settings that include clients who come from diverse ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds all while maintaining sensitivity towards the needs of all patients.
Benefits:
We offer a range of 100% employer paid benefits including health and dental care covered at 100% for basic and 100% for prescription drugs and vision coverage for both the employee and eligible dependants. We also offer excellent in-house training covering all aspects of working with our clients and other core skills, and are committed to providing our staff with a wide range of learning and development opportunities. This position is also entitled to accrual of paid stat, sick pay, and three weeks’ prorated vacation. We also offer an employer matched pension plan.
Qualifications
Completion of Grade 12 plus a minimum of one year of dental reception or Certified Dental Assistant training.
Ability to manage both paper and electronic information effectively and communicate well both orally and in writing.
Experience that includes:
Familiarity with the Tracker system and/or other dental software programs.
Skills in assisting with sterilization would be an asset.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and the ability to maintain good working relationships with colleagues.
Ability to function and work cooperatively with several dentists and as a member of an interdisciplinary team, and with members of the community.
Responsibilities:
Provides reception services for the dental clinic, including answering all phone calls, making appointments, taking and relaying message and booking appointments for referrals. Confirms appointments on a daily basis; organizes charts for the day’s patients; enters and updates patient information.
Processes payments and insurance claims and forms, including
receiving and recording payments for dental services and bulk insurance payments; balancing and reporting the Daily Bank Deposit.
May assist with month end reconciliation and statistics.
Determines and confirms insurance benefits, explains insurability or costs to patients and assists with billing.
Performs clerical duties including organizing current and dead files; maintains office supplies and performs other related duties when appropriate, including chairside assistance if qualified.
Communication and information sharing, participates actively in staff meetings, discusses inquiries for information with internal and external contacts, answers routine inquiries and refers questions to the appropriate person if necessary.
Acts within the spirit and intent of the Society’s Code of Professional Conduct.
Requirements
Complete the Ministry of Public Safety and Solicitor General Criminal Record Check.
Job Information
Hourly Wage Rate
$25.13 - $27.16.
Work Location
713 Johnson Street
-
Cool Aid Dental Clinic.
Work Days and Times
Monday – Thursday 8:30am to 4:30pm, and Friday 8:30am to 3:30pm.
Weekly Hours
35 hours per week.
Union
Exempt.
Benefits
Eligible for 100% employer paid benefits including pension, health and dental care.
Job Type
Permanent – Full-time.

About MRU
Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University grew into a vibrant college in the 1930s and became a mid-sized university in 2009. Mount Royal has carved out a distinct niche by offering smaller class sizes, a robust liberal education and unique undergraduate programs. Currently, more than 15,000 credit students choose from 13 bachelor degrees and 38 majors.
Mount Royal University is located in the traditional territories of the Niitsitapi (Blackfoot) and the people of the Treaty 7 region in southern Alberta, which includes the Siksika, the Piikani, the Kainai, the Tsuut'ina and the Iyarhe Nakoda. We are situated on land where the Bow River meets the Elbow River. The traditional Blackfoot name of this place is "Mohkinstsis," which we now call the city of Calgary. The city of Calgary is also home to the Métis Nation.
Mount Royal University is committed to removing barriers and fostering the inclusion of voices that have been historically underrepresented or discouraged in our society. In support of our belief that diversity in our faculty and staff enriches the work, learning and research experiences for the entire campus community, we strongly encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply and self-identify.
About Procurement Services
Procurement Services, a department within Finance and Commercial Operations, is responsible to manage, administer and coordinate supplier purchases and agreements relating to goods, services, furniture, equipment, capital construction and renovations for all university faculties, departments and research initiatives.
Procurement Services ensures that procurement activity is conducted in a fair, equitable and transparent process to provide the best overall value to the University. It also ensures compliance with University policies, public sector legislative requirements, competitive bidding laws and trade agreements.
About the Role
Mount Royal University is currently seeking a Procurement Business Partner to join our Procurement Services Group, located at our Lincoln Park Campus Calgary office.
Reporting to the Manager, Procurement Services, this position will provide expertise in the procurement of specialized supplies and services, strategic capital equipment including construction expansion projects, that requires high level of due diligence and risk mitigation on behalf of the institution.
Responsibilities
Purchasing – Customer Focus - Planning
Clear understanding of public procurement procedures and how they relate to Stakeholders and/or project requirements.
Manages competitive bidding process (MERX/APC) from issuance of documents to negotiation and execution of contract.
Acts as a subject matter expert (SME) in the development of competitive bidding documents.
Ensures all required statutory and regulatory conditions are being met on every competitive bidding process including compliance with competitive bidding law.
Work closely with project managers and responsible engineers to ensure compliance with the University competitive bidding procedures.
Manages the Pre-Qualification of Contractors and Suppliers, Vendor Performance Evaluation and Preferred Vendors Programs.
Facilitates and ensures compliance and efficiency with respect to internal purchasing policies, processes and procedures.
Maintains good communication with internal departments and expected to work with all levels of the organization in a cohesive manner.
Maintains positive relationships with contractors and suppliers.
Reviewing purchasing procedures/policies recommending continual improvements to programs or operations. Assists In designing suggested improvements/changes.
Assist the Procurement Manager in the preparation of short-term and long-range goals and objectives for the procurement area that is based on the institution goals and objectives.
Qualifications
Degree, undergraduate degree, diploma or Supply Chain Management Professional Designation (SCMP) or other similar public purchasing oriented designations would be appropriate (ex: NIGP).
8 + year’s industry working experience.
Previous experience in a Post-Secondary or Public Institution would be an asset.
ERP/Banner experience would be an asset.
Highly proficient in MS Office including contract management software (CMS) would be an asset.
Able to communicate, understand, express and apply technical, business or administrative concepts.
Superior organizational and time-management skills; ability to meet deadlines.
Superior decision and problem-solving ability.
Proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities.
What We Offer
Talented and committed employees are the driving force behind student success. We strive to be an employer of choice among Canadian post-secondary institutions.
At Mount Royal University, we recognize that people are a combination of many intersecting identities; we work to cultivate an environment that welcomes the whole person, and harnesses the strength that is available in our diversity, creating a rich and inclusive workplace.
Investing in the learning and development of our employees benefits the individual and the University. A variety of services, resources and programs encourage a healthy, productive workplace. Mount Royal University offers a competitive total compensation package including health and dental benefits, pension, health and personal spending accounts, paid vacation, winter holiday closure, personal days and a free membership in our fully equipped recreation centre.
Our campus offers the convenience of a full medical clinic, dentist and pharmacy, as well as a variety of wellness services such as physiotherapists and massage therapists. Campus Recreation offers many activities, including personal training, climbing, aquatics, sports and certifications for students, employees and the public.
